description: Key milestones and events in the development and implementation of the NIH Human Virome Program

milestones.milestone: Public Workshop on Human Virome Concept
milestones.description: Initial public workshop held by NIH Common Fund to discuss the human virome concept with expert panels
Formal presentation of Human Virome Program proposal to the Division of Program Coordination, Planning, and Strategic Initiatives Council
Release of four initial Requests for Applications (RFAs): RFA-RM-23-016 (CODCC), RFA-RM-23-017 (Functional Interactions), RFA-RM-23-018 (Tools Development), RFA-RM-23-019 (Characterization Centers)
NIH staff presented program goals and answered questions about application and review process
According to NIH FAQ, awards from initial RFAs were scheduled to be made in this timeframe
RFA-RM-24-009 published (reissue of RFA-RM-23-018 for Tools Development)
Multiple institutions (Vanderbilt/UNC, UTHealth) announced receipt of $20M awards for Virome Characterization Centers
UCLA announced $20.6M award to establish Human Virome Characterization Center for the Oral-Gut-Brain Axis
Major award grants begin activation with infrastructure establishment as the initial focus
To be held approximately 3 months after awards are made, according to RFA documentation
Protocol standardization, cohort definition, data management procedures established across consortium
First sample collection and processing expected to commence after setup phase
First full consortium meeting (estimated one year after kickoff)
Peak period for sample collection and processing across all centers
Focus shifts to comprehensive analysis and integration of collected data
Projected end of first phase of Human Virome Program (FY2024-FY2028)
